data.title: Leadership Councils and Advisory Boards
data.text:
The Public Interest/Public Service Council is a large group of senior Law School alumni who have fostered social change or protected the public good in meaningful ways, both in the United States and abroad. Council members are experts and leaders (past and present) in the public interest and government sectors, both in the U.S. and abroad.

Council members actively support Columbia’s core belief that serving the public interest should be part of the professional life of every student and graduate. Members are available to engage with current students or recent alumni to provide support or advice.

Please contact Erica Smock, Assistant Dean and Dean for Public Interest/Public Service Law and Careers, to get involved.

MEMBERS
